qas.question: Most graduate schools specializing in immunology follow what organization's parameters?
What is the name of the immunology school at Mount Sinai?
AAI immunology courses include what two components?

answers.text: Introductory Course and an Advance Course

qas.question: What does the introductory AAI immunology course do?

answers.text: gives students an overview of the basics of immunology

qas.question: The Langone Medical Center is part of what college?

context: Most graduate immunology schools follow the <a0_0>AAI courses<a0_0/> immunology which are offered throughout numerous schools in the United States. For example, in New York State, there are several universities that offer the AAI courses immunology: Albany Medical College, Cornell University, <a1_0>Icahn School of Medicine<a1_0/> at Mount Sinai, <a4_0>New York University<a4_0/> Langone Medical Center, University at Albany (SUNY), University at Buffalo (SUNY), University of Rochester Medical Center and Upstate Medical University (SUNY). The AAI immunology courses include an <a2_0>Introductory Course and an Advance Course<a2_0/>. The Introductory Course is a course that <a3_0>gives students an overview of the basics of immunology<a3_0/>.
